# TIOTF GOVERNANCE PLAYBOOK

(Early Members & Board Onboarding Guide)

> This document is **informational**, not legally binding.

---

## 1. What TIOTF Is

TIOTF is the **open technology backbone** of the tire, fleet, and service-provider ecosystem.

It combines:

* Apache-style open-source governance
* Linux Foundation-style working groups
* Mission-driven nonprofit oversight

---

## 2. Two-Stage Governance Model

### Stage 1 — Formation (0–10 Members)

Governed by the Interim Governing Committee.

Focus areas:

* Foundational architecture
* Initial standards and APIs
* Cybersecurity framework
* Formation of Durion Solutions
* Preparing for Board elections

### Stage 2 — Full Governance (10+ Members)

* Board elections occur
* 25/25/25/25 representation activates
* Committees gain formal authority
* TIOTF becomes a permanent industry institution

---

## 3. Governance Principles

* **Neutrality** — No vendor control
* **Openness** — Open standards and software
* **Transparency** — Visible processes
* **Security** — Cybersecurity is foundational
* **Interoperability** — Fragmentation reduction
* **Non-commercial governance** — Commerce lives in Durion

---

## 4. How Decisions Are Made

| Decision Type          | Authority                            |
| ---------------------- | ------------------------------------ |
| Technical architecture | Technical Steering Committee         |
| Cybersecurity policy   | Cybersecurity & Trust Council        |
| Certification          | Certification & Compliance Committee |
| Strategy & fiduciary   | Board of Directors                   |

---

## 5. Role of Durion Solutions

Durion:

* Is wholly owned by TIOTF
* Provides commercial services
* Operates independently but under Foundation control

Durion **may not**:

* Influence standards unfairly
* Restrict open-source access
* Gain preferential certification treatment

---

## 6. Expectations of Early Members

Early members are expected to:

* Participate actively
* Contribute domain expertise
* Shape foundational standards
* Recruit additional members

Influence is **highest early**.

---

## 7. Board Onboarding

Directors receive:

* Charter and Bylaws
* Antitrust and Ethics policies
* IP and Trademark policies
* Initial budgets and roadmap

Directors must:

* Act in the industry’s best interest
* Disclose conflicts
* Maintain neutrality

---

## 8. Roadmap Influence Process

1. Proposal submission
2. Committee review
3. Public comment
4. Board ratification (if required)

---

## 9. Governance Risks & Mitigations

| Risk                  | Mitigation              |
| --------------------- | ----------------------- |
| Vendor dominance      | Board seat limits       |
| Fragmented priorities | Structured roadmap      |
| Security neglect      | Mandatory CSO + Council |
| Subsidiary overreach  | Wholly-owned control    |

---

## 10. Long-Term Vision

TIOTF becomes the **canonical standards and technology foundation** for the tire industry:

* Unified data models
* Secure service platforms
* Open-source enterprise systems
* Industry-wide modernization

---
